Name: Jason
From where?: Argos countryside (somewhere across the Anauros river). Maybe Phylake?
Known For?: Famous mother, who was a descendant of mythical king Mynian
Note: Prophesized to bring about the death of King Pelias of Argos, as well as to return safely with the golden fleece

Name: Orpheus
From where?: Piera, in Thrace. He’s prince of the Bithonians.
Known For?: Charmed boulders, rivers, and trees with his music
Note: Possibly done so for the construction of the Argo itself

Name: Asteríon
From where?: Peiresiai of Thessalia at the junction of two rivers (Apidanos and Enipeus).

Name: Polyphémos
Known For?: His father is famous for fighting against the Centaurs alongside the Lapiths.

Name: Iphiklos
Relative to?: Uncle to Jason through Jason’s mother

Name: Admétos
Note: they are sheep–rich

Name: Erytos
Son of?: Hermes, born by Antianeira (daughter of Menétes)
Note: Their land is rich in wheatfields

Name: Echíon
Son of?: Hermes, born by Antianeira (daughter of Menétes)
Note: Their land is rich in wheatfields

Name: Aithálides
Note: Their land is rich in wheatfields

Name: Korónos
Known For?: Kaineus is known for fighting the "Kentaurs" (not centaurs) and driving them back single handedly. It seems he died during this heroic act. Koronos is not (yet) equal to Kaineus.
Note: Not yet his father’s equal

Name: Mopsos
Note: The greatest bird seeing mortal. Possibly another name for Tiresaisx

Name: Menoitios
Relative to?: uncle of Eurytion as his brother is Iros, who is father Eurytion
Note: Ordered by Actor to, “go with the flower of the heroes.”

Name: Eurytion
Relative to?: nephew to Menoitios through his father
Note: Iros was also a son of Actor, making Eurytion an uncle to Menoitios

Name: Erybótes
Note: “far-famed Erybótes” also probably from Opous because mentioned in the same sentence as Eurytion

Name: Oileus
Note: “peerless in prowess”

Name: Kanthos
Known For?: Apparently dying in this journey, in Africa, along with Mopso

Name: Klytios
Note: Eúrytos is famous for using a bow Apollo gave him to compete with the god

Name: Iphitos
Note: Eúrytos is famous for using a bow Apollo gave him to compete with the god

Name: Peleus
Note: Killed his brother Phókos and came from Phthia to join Jason

Name: Télamon
Note: Killed his brother Phókos and came from Salamis to join Jason

Name: Pháleros
Note:
Sent by his father Alkon though he had no other
sons to support his old age and livelihood

Name: Tiphys
Note: Recruited by Athena to join Jason’s crew

Name: Argos
Note: Given instructions by Athena on how to make the ship

Name: Phleias
Note: Enjoyed great wealth due to his father

Name: Tálaos
Relative to?: Brother of Areïos and half brother of Leódokos (by Pero)
Note:
120: the Aiolid Melámpous
endured a heavy affliction in the stables of Iphiklos

Name: Areïos
Relative to?: Brother of Tálaos and half brother of Leódokos (by Pero)
Note:
120: the Aiolid Melámpous
endured a heavy affliction in the stables of Iphiklos

Name: Leódokos
Note:
120: the Aiolid Melámpous
endured a heavy affliction in the stables of Iphiklos

Name: Herakles
Note: Returned from his 4th labor, dumped the Erymánthian boar onto the ground, and set out to join Jason along with his squire Hylas

Name: Nauplios
Son of?: Klytonéos, who is son of Naubolos, who is son of Lernos, who is son of Priotos, who was the son of someone also named Nauplios, who was the son of Poseidon and Amymoné.
Ability?: Not entirely clear. It seems he has a relative, also named Naupilos, who “excelled all mortals in seamanship” but they’re not the same person it seems
Note:
135: “he was the son of Naubolos's son Klytonéos,
and Naubolos's father was Lernos, and Lernos, we know, the son of
Proitos, whom Nauplios sired”

Name: Idmon
Known For?: Seeing his own fate on this trip and embarking upon it anyways

Name: Polydeukes
Relative to?: twin brother of Kastor, also brother of Helen and Clytemnestra
Note: Also known as Pollux

Name: Kastor
Relative to?: twin brother of Polydeukes, also brother of Helen and Clytemnestra
Note: Also known as Castor

Name: Lynkeus
Ability?: big muscles, sharp eyesight that can see underground
Note: overconfident

Name: Idas
Note: arrogant and overconfident

Name: Periklymenos
Ability?: boundless strength and shapeshifting when in the heat of battle

Name: Amphídamas
Relative to?: Brother of Képheus and uncle of Ankaios

Name: Képheus
Relative to?: Brother of Amphídamas and uncle of Ankaios

Name: Ankaios
Note: Dressed in a bearksin and has a two headed axe because his grandfather, Aleos, hid his arms in an attempt to stop him from going

Name: Augeias
Note:
longed to see the land of Kolchis,
and King Aiëtés

Name: Euphémos
Note: allegedly can run on the surface of the water

Name: Ankaios
Note: held an important role at the temple of Hera on Samos

Name: Meleágros
Relative to?: Nephew of Laoköon through his father and nephew of Iphiklos through his mother
Note:
Joined only as a boy. 195: no better man, I think, ever
would have joined them save Herakles himself, had he only
waited among the Aitolians one year longer to grow up

Name: Laoköon
Note: sent to watch over Meleágros by Oineus

Name: Palaimónios
Note: lame of both feet

Name: Iphitos
Son of?: Naubolos who was son of Ornytos
Note: Had once hosted Jason as a guest when Jason was inquiring an oracle about his voyage

Name: Akástos
Note: joined upon Athena’s orders
